description: On Sunday 17th September, we celebrate the historic takeover of Crystal Palace Park by the charitable, community-led Crystal Palace Park Trust.  Join us for the Garden Party: a free festival of music, markets, makers and merriment!

events.name: Drop in
events.notes: Activities will be centred on the Crystal Palace Concert Bowl in the north of the park, with live music performances from 13:00 - 17:15.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs: Crystal Palace is one of the most unique and historic public parks in the country, with the world famous Grade I listed Dinosaur sculptures, Egyptian sphinxes, Italianate terraces, the iconic Stirling Prize-nominated Concert Bowl, The Maze, a skatepark, and so much more.

The Garden Party provides an opportunity to visit these sites, meet members of the Trust and the park community groups to talk about how we can collectively give this historic open space a bright future.

factsheet.heading: Live Music and Events
paragraphs: At the time of going to press, the lineup for day includes:

10:00 - 10:30 - Kids Yoga,
11:00 - 12:00 - Adult Yoga,	
13:00 - 13:45 - Sherika Sherard,
13:50 - 14:40 - Crystal Palace Brass Band,
14:50 - 15:15 - BollyQueer,	
15.25 - 15.55 - Some Voices Choir,
16:15 - 17.15 - Saiming

travel_info: Train: Penge West, Gipsy Hill, Crystal Palace
Additional travel info: The Concert Bowl is located in the Northern corner of the Park.

name: Crystal Palace Park Trust - Garden Party
